comments.commentBody: Ron, you say you question Hillary's ethics..but you'd vote for her anyway. How is that any different than Mrs. Cinton questioning Saudi ethics, but taking money from them anyway?
Hillary did not stand by her man. She stood by her investment in her future. Does anyone think that she could have succeeded in her political career jump from First Lady to Senator without Bill?
"Speeches declaring",speeches,speeches,problem solved! This is a typical "feel goodism"  reply from the left. Speeches solve problems,intentions are sufficient and become replacements for action!!
And that is fine by her. What don't you understand?

Philanthropists Hillary Clinton and Melinda Gates are unveiling the "No Ceilings" report.  What is their advice to young women?  "Marry well."  Two women basking in the glory of the husbands are the best we can do?

Obamacare did the exact opposite of every policy recommendation made in the Heritage Foundation proposal. Every single fundamental principle and mechanism was violated, which you would know if you had read the proposal as opposed to reading Democratic talking points.

The ACA has done nothing to reduce the growth of healthcare costs. Although the current CBO estimate is lower than the estimate that was made six weeks ago, that is exclusively the result of fewer people signing up for Obamacare and the result of people having selected higher deductible and copay plans to reduce premium costs. A sizeable chunk of the "savings" to the federal government is going to be absorbed by those policy holders. And what you are ignoring is that the remaining $1.3 trillion dollar cost is incremental money flowing to big medicine that would not have otherwise been spent. Obamacare was never about health care, it was always about funneling more money to big medicine.

To suggest that Obamacare has reduced medical cost inflation is equivalent to asserting that someone who gained 100 pounds followed by a loss of ten weighs less than they did originally.

Two kittens dumped in the high desert found me over the course of a few months and I realized they were my healing--sent by the angels--to help restore my heart as my mother was dying. So much love, such precious gifts.
I agree with you 100%.

I think that the less expensive versions could be useful when exercising or traveling, courtesy of the apps and the tap prompts.  But if I were to buy a luxury timepiece, it would be a classic brand like Patek Philippe or Rolex.

Follow-up: I just now saw the note from Cox and Rathvon a month ago asking whether we wanted harder puzzles or if they were OK as they are currently. OK, I like them just like this.

And as long as we can request what we like, I would like to vote for more foreign-language-related clues, although some feel that everything should be English-only. Several years back, there was clue asking for a French "Goodbye." Since "A bientot," which I think was the answer, has the same number of letters as "Au revoir," there were a lot of complaints, and Cox and Rathvon apologized for the ambiguity. What was that apology about? Everyone knows that one has to wait sometimes when doing any puzzle to choose the correct answer. There are so many things I know little or nothing about, like science, or on the lighter side, cars, products, and pop music of the last forty years. Why aren't languages a valid subject like anything else? We don't all have to know everything about everything to complete a puzzle.

Perfectly understandable for the confusion CS, as John and Martin have practically morphed into one!

Howie
Merri introduced me to Gordon Lightfoot. I still love his music.

and Elke

Mac K -you also already have a Calliope to play with :))

Martin, this song was the last one I learned to play on the piano before I gave up my dreams of replacing Van Cliburn.  Actually I hated piano lessons and this was my last gasp,  I came, I learned, I retired.

What you are not getting is that Hillary has the same problem Kerry had in 2004 and Romney had in 2012. They are all unauthentic.

When Kerry accepted the nomination, he saluted and said, "Reporting for duty." His political claim to fame had always been that he was anti-war. While he was still in the military he had slandered and lied about the military. He was currently running as an anti-war candidate. The liberals were going to vote for him, and did not count it in his favor that he had briefly served in the Navy. By making a fake appeal to those who actually support the military, he guaranteed that they would not support him.

Romney's fatal flaw was his unwillingness to disavow Romneycare, despite the fact that the only aspects of it that were successful were the result of Massachusetts receiving special Medicaid funding arranged by Teddy. Voters who would have supported him did not believe that he would work to replace Obamacare. Liberals would like to believe that evangelical Christians stayed home because he was Mormon, but the truth of the situation was that he appeared to be a little too much of an East Coast liberal big government guy to be trusted.

Hillary is now trying to run as an advocate for women's empowerment, despite having been an enabler of a misogynist. She did nothing to further the status of abused women while in the Senate or as SOS. She is a wealthy white woman of privilege, not an advocate for anyone except herself.

Clinton is a chameleon and will turn whatever color is necessary to get elected. She will then say she did not have anything to do with anything about anything like she did with Benghazi. When she finally speaks about emailgate it will be that someone else put the server in and told her it was OK.  From Arkansas to DC to NY to DC a trail of deception and shifting face to whatever propaganda is necessary for the cause.
The Clinton's are all about the Clinton's.  They are uber 1%ers that have fooled most of the liberal following that they are one of us.
WOWS....Women's should be very proud of how Hillary stands by her husband after his infidelity .....wow what an example

"She is not as brilliant as everyone says she is, either:"
Say what, brilliant?
She hired an army of 200+ mercenaries (consultants) to feed her "ideas and rationale" about what to say or do? She never lived paycheck to paycheck like 99% of us Dems who want to vote for her. She lacks any coherent, persuasive and compelling ideas about what’s ailing working families. A self-serving, polarizing empty suit with super capabilities for making easy fast money (cattle trade, Wall Street speeches). Lest we forget, the Clintons perfected the art of cut corners and manipulations:
we feel your pain
we are working for the American people
we are penniless broke.
Three mansions in the Hamptons, Chappaqua, and DC…and they are penniless broke!
What a fraud

It just feels like the other shoe dropping.  It "does" matter, a whole lot, that you compromise yourself to the point of taking millions from these thug-regimes.  Oh, Bill had such a slick and predictable excuse.  It's always rationalize with these two.  Yes, I will vote for her if she is nominated but only if it means otherwise someone like Jeb Bush (who would be even worse) but this is such a terrible choice.   She is not as brilliant as everyone says she is, either: For heaven's sake she did what is just about unforgivable and extremely stupid and voted to invade Iraq!  Doesn't anyone who supports her care about that catastrophic lack of judgment?  I guess not! She is not a leader, not a person who is capable of true altruism or even good judgement.  Nor was her spouse.  But then, look at the Bush family and what are we going to do?  Vote Independent and end up letting in Jeb?
Hillary speaks from both sides of her mouth.....women need to take note.....

If more men would stop cheating and lying to their wives, the divorce rate would fall a heck of a lot faster than waiting for "strong" women to "stand by their man." Hilary's standing by her man was designed to maximize her chances of achieving higher office and perhaps the Presidency. Otherwise, as soon as Bill was out of office she would have been out the door, as a truly strong woman would have have been.

Under the law, insurance companies were obligated to refund premiums if cost of care was less than 80% of premiums. The other 20% was available for overhead plus profits. For 2015, Obama has decided that they only have to refund premiums if cost of care is less than 78%. That gives the insurers another 2% to put toward overhead plus profits.

Although the theory was that the insurance companies were limited to 20% for profit and overhead, Obama decided that what he really meant was that the insurance companies were guaranteed 20% for profit and overhead. So any insurance company that spends more than 80% will get a check from the taxpayers for the difference. By the way, the Congress never appropriated the money, so it's illegal for Obama to give it away.
no, it shows that she is a calculating politician
BU BU BUT BUSH!!!! is old man, just because "the other guys do it" doesnt mean you should excuse your side. both sides should be ashamed of dealing with those countries.

sure, let me use that excuse on my taxes

This seems to qualify as a hoax or a Hollywood-style wagging the dog, idea. I mean no legitimately elected Congress person with knowledge of our Constitution would do such a short-sighted thing, right?
those are the same people who think her answer of "what difference  does it make!!!" was a good answer
that has nothing to do with her using a personal email acct.

I find the chart of real median income really interesting.  Can anyone explain why (since the 70s) a drop in real income seems to presage a recession.  The recession seems to kick in about half way down that decline. This suggests a different picture what is going on during these cycles than I would have expected.  First real wages decline, then a recession is triggered. This stimulates the FED to loosen economic policy, then, depending on the size of the decline, there is an eventual turn around.  Probably reading too much from one chart...
